abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Project will
            assist the Government to strengthen its capabilities in
            macroeconomic management, and to further the development of
            a macroeconomic framework for medium- and long-term
            planning. In particular, the project will provide consultant
            and specialist services, fellowships and equipment. This in
            turn will assist the government to: (i) develop a coherent
            and realistic macroeconomic framework; (ii) introduce
            improved techniques of economic analysis; and (iii)
            strengthen project identification and evaluation
            capabilities. It will also help the government to; (iv)
            improve management information systems; (v) develop an
            efficient accounting and disbursement system; and (vi)
            provide appropriate training in these specialized areas. The
            Technical Assistance Project will also include studies to
            formulate programs to strengthen the country's
            accounting and auditing capabilities and performance, and to
            improve the efficiency of the domestic building construction sector.
